subject: Re: king plus font in open office
messageBody:
Perhaps this might help? http://www.mepis.org/node/727

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "peter_r_guinness" <malt99@...>
wrote:
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "doompenguin4d"
> <doompenguin4d@> wrote:
> >
> > What distro of Linux do you use? I use Ubuntu, and I got it working
> on
> > my machine, but I don't know if the steps I used would work for other
> > types of Linux.
> >
> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "peter_r_guinness" <malt99@>
> > wrote:
> > >
> > > Can anyone get the king-plus font to work in open-office on linux.
> (It
> > > does work with every other text program that I run on linux, eg:
> > > KOffice).
> > >
> >
>
> I use Mepis Linux (its debian based). When I use the king2 font in OO
> all I get is little rectangles.
>
